answers.answer: Hi there. This is a manifestation of peripheral neuropathy, sensory to be precise since it is affecting only sensory nerve, could be due to many causes like diabetes which you don’t have, hypertension, sarcoidisis, paraproteiniemias,etc. extreme cold and high doses of Pyridoxine can also  cause this. Drugs, pesticides, solvents also cause neuropathy. Do you drink alcoholic beverages? This is also a common cause for neuropathy. You need to be clinically evaluated by a neurologist. Leprosy, sleeping foot due to nerve compression at lumbar vertebral level.He might run nerve conduction velocity and nerve biopsy if required.Hope this helps. All the best.

question: I 'm 31 yo female with on and off tingling sensation in left big toe,about 4-5 times a week and each time lasts about less than a minute. It can happen during sitting, standing or walking. I don't have diabetes or B12 deficiency( I know they can cause tingling). What may be the problem?Thanks.
title: tingling sensation in left big toe
